e4: Adopting the new policy aligns with ethical standards of financial transparency and accuracy, reducing potential legal and reputational risks. While investors are accustomed to adjusting figures, providing unbiased data fosters credibility and trust. Clear communication during the transition can mitigate short-term confusion and benefit all stakeholders in the long run.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness. It should present financial data without distortion or bias, ensuring that all investors, regardless of sophistication, have equal access to truthful information. Additionally, it should comply with legal standards and consider stakeholder communication to manage transitions effectively.
e6: Yes, I would ask how management plans to communicate the policy change to ensure investor understanding and minimize confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to monitor market reactions and address any concerns from retail investors who might be less aware of the shift.
